meta.title: Port Chester Schools District Home Page - Port Chester Public Schools

body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":3827,"title":"Schools to remain closed through May 15, 2020","body":"
Due to the COVID-19 coronavirus crisis, Governor Cuomo has decided to continue to keep schools closed through May 15. Please review important details on the school website as updates occur regularly.","dateStart":"2020-03-13T21:09:21Z","baseGroupName":"PORT CHESTER PUBLIC SCHOOLS","hash":"xCwV+l2edCBv34YrTFtxQCRzAaG3pbVSVGhOHrcMfYc=","updateDate":"2020-04-16T22:18:16Z"}];

img.alt: Port Chester Public Schools Home Page

div.h3: April 21 and April 23 Board of Education meetings to be live-streamed

div.p: Due to concerns relating to coronavirus, the Board of Education meeting scheduled for Tuesday, April 21, 2020 and Thursday April 23, 2020, will be live-streamed and can be viewed here. Both meetings begin at 5 p.m.

div.h3: Schools to remain closed through at least May 15, 2020

div.p: Following an announcement from Governor Cuomo on April 16, 2020, schools will remain closed at least through May 15. All long distance learning will continue through that time.

div.h3: Mental Health Resource Guide

span.style: caret-color: #002451; color: #002451; font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-size-adjust: auto; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; display: inline !important; float: none;

p.span: Please access this important collection of resources and information for a variety of supports your family may need during these challenging times. You can find this and other important guides on our

a.title: https://www.portchesterschools.org/distance_learning_resources_for_parents

div.h3: New York Assessment Update, April 8, 2020

div.p: NYSED announced the cancellation of June Regents Examinations (including LOTE Checkpoint B) for the 2020 school year. Regents credit will be awarded to students based upon successful completion of high school courses. Exemptions will be granted for students requiring Regents exam credit for graduation. For details about the cancellation, see April 7th memo here. Additional information can also be found on the NYSED website, here.
NYSED has suspended all of the following exams:

ul.li: New York State Grades 3-8 English Language Arts Test;
New York State Grades 3-8 Mathematics Test;
New York State Grade 4 Elementary-Level Science Test;
New York State Grade 8 Intermediate-Level Science Test;
New York State English as a Second Language Achievement Test (NYSESLAT) in Grades K-12; and
New York State Alternate Assessment (NYSAA) for students with severe cognitive disabilities in Grades 3-8 and high school.

div.p: Click here for the March 20th memo.

div.h3: Free online AP Exam Review Sessions

a.strong: High school students who are taking AP exams have an opportunity for free online review classes.
Click here for the information in Spanish.

div.span: News & Announcements - Port Chester High School

div.h3: Technical suppport available for students

div.p: The Lower Hudson Regional Information Center has partnered with the Port Chester-Rye Union Free School District to provide technical support to students on district owned devices while remote learning is occurring. Support is available from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. Monday through Friday. Please have a parent fill out the form at https://lhric.service-now.com/student to request assistance and provide us with the information needed for our technician to work with you on the issue. The technician will use the Parent/Guardian's email to communicate and in some cases may need to call to schedule a support session.

div.h3: Activity fun for students in Grades K-5

span.style: caret-color: #002451; color: #002451; font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-size-adjust: auto; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration: none; display: inline !important; float: none;

p.span: New for families in K-5! If you are looking for some educational supplemental activities for your child to do, try some of the projects and activities listed on our Activity Choice Boards for Extended School Closure, listed on our Student Resource Page.

div.h3: Superintendent's letter regarding school vacation days

a.strong: Please read the following letter from the superintendent of school regarding the use of vacation days.

div.h3: Preliminary Budget Presentation, 2020-21

a.strong: Click here for a look at the superintendent's preliminary budget for the 2020-2021 school year.

div.h3: Child care availability for healthcare workers and first responders

div.p: In an effort to help assist those on the front lines battling the COVID-19 pandemic, Weschester County is creating opportunities to supply child care for the children of healthcare workers and first responders in Westchester. Click here for more information.

div.h3: Distance Learning Guides for Families

p.span: . This guide will be updated weekly, so we ask that you check back regularly as new information is shared.

div.h3: New times for food distribution

div.p: This is an important update from the Port Chester Public Schools for Monday, March 23. Food distribution will take place from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. at Edison School and JFK and from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at King St. and Park Ave schools. Please note the time change for Edison School and JFK. We encourage all of our families to take advantage of this important program.

Este es un mensaje importante de las Escuelas Públicas de Port Chester. El servicio de comida estará disponible de 10 a.m. a 2 p.m. en las escuelas Edison y JFK; y de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m. en las escuelas King St. y Park Ave. Por favor tome en cuenta el cambio de horario en las escuelas Edison y JFK. Animamos a todas nuestras familias que se aprovechen de este programa importante.

div.h3: Instructions for Google Classroom

div.p: Parents and students can find instructions on using Google Classroom on each school webpage or on the following links: Instructions for Google Classroom or at Instrucciones para Google Classroom.

div.h3: Support financial equity and Foundation Aid for Port Chester!

div.div: Please read and sign the petition! It is critical that New York State fund our district equitably as our enrollment continues to grow and costs increase! Our children deserve the same chance for a high quality education as everyone else.

div.h3: Long Distance Learning: Jaime Rufo, Astronomy

div.p: Take a closer look at how one teacher is approaching long distance learning. Astronomy teacher Jaime Rufo is looking to keep her students motivated, present content and ensure their emotional needs are being met too.

div.span: News & Announcements - Port Chester Middle School

div.h3: Be counted!

div.p: The deadline for the 2020 Census has been extended until August 14, 2020. Click here for more information on how you can be counted!

div.h3: Rams on the Rise

div.p: Although school looks very different these days we are always happy to celebrate our students! Meet Jeimy Zarcaras and Camila Berneo, our latest Rams on the Rise!

div.span: News & Announcements - Port Chester High School

div.h3: Take-out meals will continue to be available

div.p: All Port Chester children are eligible to received a take-out meal each day while school is out of session. Click here for more information on food distribution locations.

div.h3: Draft: District-wide Safety and Emergency Management Plan

div.p: The Port Chester Union Free School District has published a draft of its safety plan. Click here to learn more about the details.

div.aria-label: Distance Learning Access and Latest Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information

h2.span: Distance Learning Access and Latest Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information

div.p: The Port Chester Public Schools has developed distance learning opportunities for students.

For the latest district information regarding Coronavirus, please visit our Coronavirus Updates page. We thank you for your patience and flexibility as we all work through this unprecedented event. Information is also available on our Social Media platforms. Be sure to follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.
